gw.api.database

Class ISimpleQueryBuilder<T extends Bean>

  • gw.api.database.ISimpleQueryBuilder<T>

  • public class ISimpleQueryBuilder<T extends Bean>

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      IEntityType EntityType
      the entity type this table is querying on
      com.guidewire.pl.system.database.TableObject OldTableObjectObject

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Restriction<Bean> and(BooleanExpression<Bean> exp)
      Creates a new "and" expression on this restriction.

      All operations on the expression will operate in terms of the condition this expression was passed in to. For example:

      xxx.and(new BooleanExpression<T>() { public void execute(Restriction<T> restriction) { restriction.compare("A", Equals, 10); restriction.compare("A", Equals, 20); restriction.compare("A", Equals, 30); } });

      Will find all things that have (A=10 and A=20 and A=30)
      Restriction<Bean> between(IQueryablePropertyInfo column, Object startValue, Object endValue)
      Compares a column against two values using a between clause. This will throw an exception if either startValue or endValue, or both are null.

      Value types of Key, Bean, and typekeys are accepted

      A value type of DBFunction is handled as well.
      Restriction<Bean> between(DBFunction column, Object startValue, Object endValue)
      Compares a column wrapped by a SQL function against a value given an operation type.

      Value types of Key, Bean, and typekeys are accepted

      A value type of DBFunction is handled as well.
      Restriction<QT> between(PropertyReference<Bean,V> propRef, V startValue, V endValue)
      Compares a property against two values using a between clause. This will throw an exception if either startValue or endValue, or both are null.
      Restriction<QT> between(String propertyName, Object startValue, Object endValue)
      Compares a property against two values using a between clause. This will throw an exception if either startValue or endValue, or both are null. Value types of Key, Bean, and typekeys are accepted A value type of DBFunction is handled as well.
      Table<Bean> cast(IEntityType subtype)
      Casts this table to the given subtype. This is used to enforce all types of this table match the given sub type.
      Restriction<Bean> compare(IQueryablePropertyInfo column, Range<T> range)
      Compares a column against a range.
      Restriction<Bean> compare(DBFunction column, Range<T> range)
      Compares a column wrapped by a SQL function against a range.
      Restriction<Bean> compare(IQueryablePropertyInfo column, Relop op, Object value)
      Compares a column against a value given an operation type.

      Value types of Key, Bean, and typekeys are accepted

      A value type of DBFunction is handled as well.
      Restriction<Bean> compare(ColumnRef column, Relop op, Object value)
      Compares a column from another table against a value given an operation type.

      Value types of Key, Bean, and typekeys are accepted

      A value type of DBFunction is handled as well.
      Restriction<Bean> compare(DBFunction column, Relop op, Object value)
      Compares a column wrapped by a SQL function against a value given an operation type.

      Value types of Key, Bean, and typekeys are accepted

      A value type of DBFunction is handled as well.
      Restriction<QT> compare(PropertyReference<Bean,V> propRef, Relop op, V value)
      Compares a property against a value given an operation type.
      Restriction<QT> compare(String propertyName, Relop op, Object value)
      Compares a property against a value given an operation type. Value types of Key, Bean, and typekeys are accepted A value type of DBFunction is handled as well.
      Restriction<QT> compare(PropertyReference<Bean,V> propRef, Range<V> value)
      Compares a property against a range.
      Restriction<QT> compare(String propertyName, Range<Object> value)
      Compares a property against a range.
      Restriction<Bean> compareIgnoreCase(IQueryablePropertyInfo column, Relop op, Object value)
      Compares a character-based column against a character-based value given an operation type.

      String comparisons will be case-insensitive and as configured for linguistic search. Can cause poor performance with columns not marked as supportsLinguisticSearch and without an indexed denorm column.
      Restriction<Bean> compareIgnoreCase(ColumnRef column, Relop op, Object value)
      Compares a character-based column against a character-based value given an operation type. String comparisons will be case-insensitive and as configured for linguistic search. Can cause poor performance with columns not marked as supportsLinguisticSearch and without an indexed denorm column.
      Restriction<QT> compareIgnoreCase(PropertyReference<Bean,String> propRef, Relop op, String value)
      Compares a property against a value given an operation type. The comparison is done using the configured lignuistic search function, which varies by database type, but is typically "lower", that is, case insenstively.
      Restriction<QT> compareIgnoreCase(String propertyName, Relop op, Object value)
      Compares a property against a value given an operation type. The comparison is done using the configured lignuistic search function, which varies by database type, but is typically "lower", that is, case insenstively. Value must be of type String. If a case-insensitive comparison that helps drive the query plan is done on a large table, then the property should have the supportsLinguisticSearch attribute and the denorm column indexed.
      Restriction<Bean> compareIn(DBFunction function, Collection<Object> values)
      Compares a function against a range of values using an in clause
      Restriction<Bean> compareIn(IQueryablePropertyInfo column, Collection<Object> values)
      Compares a column against a range of values using an in clause

      Compares a property against a range of values using an in clause
      Restriction<QT> compareIn(String propertName, Object[] values)
      Compares a property against a range of values using an in clause

      Compares a function against a range of values using a not in clause

      Compares a varchar column against a string value using a contains clause (i.e. column='%string%'

      Compares a varchar property against a string value using a contains clause (i.e. property='%string%')

      Restriction<Bean> having()
      Restriction<Bean> or(BooleanExpression<Bean> exp)
      Creates a new "or" expression on this restriction.

      All operations on the expression will operate in terms of the condition this expression was passed in to. For example:

      xxx.or(new BooleanExpression<T>() { public void execute(Restriction<T> restriction) { restriction.compare("A", Equals, 10); restriction.compare("A", Equals, 20); restriction.compare("A", Equals, 30); } });

      Will find all things that have (A=10 or A=20 or A=30)
      Restriction<Bean> startsWith(IQueryablePropertyInfo column, String value, boolean ignoreCase)
      Compares a varchar column against a string value using a LIKE clause
      Restriction<Bean> startsWith(IQueryablePropertyInfo column, DBFunction value, boolean ignoreCase)
      Compares a varchar column against a DBFunction.Constant string value using a LIKE clause

      Value types of DBFunction.ConstantFunction that return a string only are accepted
      Restriction<QT> startsWith(String propertyName, DBFunction value, boolean ignoreCase)
      Compares a varchar property against a string value using a starts-with clause (i.e. property='string%'

      Compares a varchar property against a string value using a starts-with clause (i.e. property='string%'

      Compares a varchar property against a string value using a starts-with clause (i.e. property='string%'
      Table<Bean> subselect(DBFunction columnInThisTable, InOperation op, DBFunction columnInJoinTable)
      Joins a table with this table using a sub-select clause.

      Two columns are required, a column in the current table and a column in the join table.

      This will generate an IN clause if the operation is CompareIn and a NOT IN clause if the operation is CompareNotIn
      Table<Bean> subselect(IEntityPropertyInfo columnInThisTable, InOperation op, IQuery<T> queryToJoinTo, IEntityPropertyInfo columnInQuery)
      Joins a column from table with a column from another query.

      This will generate an IN clause if the operation is CompareIn and a NOT IN clause if the operation is CompareNotIn

      Restriction<Bean> withinDistance(ColumnRef column, String beanPathToSpatialColumn, SpatialPoint center, Number distance, UnitOfDistance unitOfDistance)
      Searches for points that are 'distance' units from center. The query result is sorted by distance from center in ascending order. Other order by columns may be specified, however distance is always implicitly the first expression in the sort.
      Restriction<Bean> withinDistance(IQueryablePropertyInfo column, String beanPathToSpatialColumn, SpatialPoint center, Number distance, UnitOfDistance unitOfDistance)
      Searches for points that are 'distance' units from center. The query result is sorted by distance from center in ascending order. Other order by columns may be specified, however distance is always implicitly the first expression in the sort.
      Restriction<Bean> withinDistance(IQueryablePropertyInfo column, SpatialPoint center, Number distance, UnitOfDistance unitOfDistance)
      Searches for points that are 'distance' units from center. The query result is sorted by distance from center in ascending order. Other order by columns may be specified, however distance is always implicitly the first expression in the sort.
      Restriction<QT> withinDistance(String propertyName, SpatialPoint center, Double distance, UnitOfDistance unitOfDistance)
      Searches for points that are 'distance' units from center. The query result is sorted by distance from center in ascending order. Other order by columns may be specified, however distance is always implicitly the first expression in the sort.
      Restriction<QT> withinDistance(String propertyName, String beanPathToSpatialColumn, SpatialPoint center, Double distance, UnitOfDistance unitOfDistance)
      Searches for points that are 'distance' units from center. The query result is sorted by distance from center in ascending order. Other order by columns may be specified, however distance is always implicitly the first expression in the sort.
      Restriction<Bean> withinPolygon(ColumnRef column, String beanPathToSpatialColumn, boolean findIn, SpatialPoint point)
      Searches for polygons that contain or do not contain the given point. Points on the boundary of the polygon are considered within. Note that this method is overloaded to allow searching of either points in a given polygon or polygons that contain a given point.
      Restriction<Bean> withinPolygon(ColumnRef column, String beanPathToSpatialColumn, boolean findIn, SpatialPolygon polygon)
      Searches for points that are within or not within the given polygon. Points on the boundary of the polygon are considered within. Note that this method is overloaded to allow searching of either points in a given polygon or polygons that contain a given point.
      Restriction<Bean> withinPolygon(IQueryablePropertyInfo column, String beanPathToSpatialColumn, boolean findIn, SpatialPolygon polygon)
      Searches for points that are within or not within the given polygon. Points on the boundary of the polygon are considered within. Note that this method is overloaded to allow searching of either points in a given polygon or polygons that contain a given point.
      Restriction<Bean> withinPolygon(IQueryablePropertyInfo column, boolean findIn, SpatialPolygon polygon)
      Searches for points that are within or not within the given polygon. Points on the boundary of the polygon are considered within. Note that this method is overloaded to allow searching of either points in a given polygon or polygons that contain a given point.
      Restriction<QT> withinPolygon(String propertyName, boolean findIn, SpatialPolygon polygon)
      Searches for points that are within or not within the given polygon. Points on the boundary of the polygon are considered within.
      Restriction<QT> withinPolygon(String propertyName, String beanPathToSpatialColumn, boolean findIn, SpatialPolygon polygon)
      Searches for points that are within or not within the given polygon. Points on the boundary of the polygon are considered within.

    • Method Detail

      • and

        Restriction<Bean> and(BooleanExpression<Bean> exp)
        Creates a new "and" expression on this restriction.

        All operations on the expression will operate in terms of the condition this expression was passed in to. For example:

        xxx.and(new BooleanExpression<T>() { public void execute(Restriction<T> restriction) { restriction.compare("A", Equals, 10); restriction.compare("A", Equals, 20); restriction.compare("A", Equals, 30); } });

        Will find all things that have (A=10 and A=20 and A=30)

        Parameters:
        exp - a block that adds predicates to the expression tree
        Returns:
        this. Used for the builder pattern

      • between

        Restriction<Bean> between(IQueryablePropertyInfo column,
                        Object startValue,
                        Object endValue)
        Compares a column against two values using a between clause. This will throw an exception if either startValue or endValue, or both are null.

        Value types of Key, Bean, and typekeys are accepted

        A value type of DBFunction is handled as well.

        Parameters:
        column - The column to compare
        startValue - The start value of the between
        endValue - The end value of the between
        Returns:
        this. Used for the builder pattern

      • between

        Restriction<Bean> between(DBFunction column,
                        Object startValue,
                        Object endValue)
        Compares a column wrapped by a SQL function against a value given an operation type.

        Value types of Key, Bean, and typekeys are accepted

        A value type of DBFunction is handled as well.

        Parameters:
        column - The column to compare
        startValue - the start value
        endValue - the end value
        Returns:
        this. Used for the builder pattern

      • compareIgnoreCase

        Restriction<Bean> compareIgnoreCase(IQueryablePropertyInfo column,
                                  Relop op,
                                  Object value)
        Compares a character-based column against a character-based value given an operation type.

        String comparisons will be case-insensitive and as configured for linguistic search. Can cause poor performance with columns not marked as supportsLinguisticSearch and without an indexed denorm column.

        Parameters:
        column - The column to compare
        op - The operation
        value - The value
        Returns:
        this. Used for the builder pattern

      • compareIgnoreCase

Can cause poor performance with columns not marked as supportsLinguisticSearch and without an indexed denorm column.

        value - The value

      • or

        Restriction<Bean> or(BooleanExpression<Bean> exp)
        Creates a new "or" expression on this restriction.

        All operations on the expression will operate in terms of the condition this expression was passed in to. For example:

        xxx.or(new BooleanExpression<T>() { public void execute(Restriction<T> restriction) { restriction.compare("A", Equals, 10); restriction.compare("A", Equals, 20); restriction.compare("A", Equals, 30); } });

        Will find all things that have (A=10 or A=20 or A=30)

        Parameters:
        exp - a block that adds predicates to the expression tree
        Returns:
        this. Used for the builder pattern

                           String value,
                           boolean ignoreCase)
        Compares a varchar column against a string value using a LIKE clause
        Parameters:
        column - The column to compare
        value - The string value to compare using a LIKE clause
        ignoreCase - True to do a case-insensitive search, false if not
        Returns:
        this. Used for the builder pattern

      • startsWith

        Restriction<Bean> startsWith(IQueryablePropertyInfo column,
                           DBFunction value,
                           boolean ignoreCase)
        Compares a varchar column against a DBFunction.Constant string value using a LIKE clause

        Value types of DBFunction.ConstantFunction that return a string only are accepted

      • subselect

        Table<Bean> subselect(DBFunction columnInThisTable,
                    InOperation op,
                    DBFunction columnInJoinTable)
        Joins a table with this table using a sub-select clause.

        Two columns are required, a column in the current table and a column in the join table.

        This will generate an IN clause if the operation is CompareIn and a NOT IN clause if the operation is CompareNotIn

        Parameters:
        columnInThisTable - a column in the current table
        op - the in clause operation
        columnInJoinTable - the column in the joining table
        Returns:
        this. Used for the builder pattern

      • withinDistance

        Restriction<Bean> withinDistance(ColumnRef column,
                               String beanPathToSpatialColumn,
                               SpatialPoint center,
                               Number distance,
                               UnitOfDistance unitOfDistance)
        Searches for points that are 'distance' units from center. The query result is sorted by distance from center in ascending order. Other order by columns may be specified, however distance is always implicitly the first expression in the sort.
        Parameters:
        column - The column to compare. Must be a column of type spatialpoint.
        beanPathToSpatialColumn - Bean path to spatial column, including root entity.
        center - The center of the search
        distance -
        unitOfDistance - The unit of distance @return this. Used for the builder pattern
        Returns:

      • withinDistance

        Restriction<Bean> withinDistance(IQueryablePropertyInfo column,
                               String beanPathToSpatialColumn,
                               SpatialPoint center,
                               Number distance,
                               UnitOfDistance unitOfDistance)
        Searches for points that are 'distance' units from center. The query result is sorted by distance from center in ascending order. Other order by columns may be specified, however distance is always implicitly the first expression in the sort.
        Parameters:
        column - The column to compare. Must be a column of type spatialpoint.
        beanPathToSpatialColumn - Bean path to spatial column, including root entity. Please specify if the column is not on the root query.
        center - The center of the search
        distance -
        unitOfDistance - The unit of distance @return this. Used for the builder pattern
        Returns:

      • withinPolygon

        Restriction<Bean> withinPolygon(ColumnRef column,
                              String beanPathToSpatialColumn,
                              boolean findIn,
                              SpatialPoint point)
        Searches for polygons that contain or do not contain the given point. Points on the boundary of the polygon are considered within. Note that this method is overloaded to allow searching of either points in a given polygon or polygons that contain a given point.
        Parameters:
        column - The column to compare. Must be a column of type spatialpoint.
        beanPathToSpatialColumn - Bean path to spatial column, including root entity.
        findIn - true for finding points in the polygon; false for finding points outside the polygons.
        point - the point to use for the search
        Returns:
        this. Used for the builder pattern

      • withinPolygon

        Restriction<Bean> withinPolygon(ColumnRef column,
                              String beanPathToSpatialColumn,
                              boolean findIn,
                              SpatialPolygon polygon)
        Searches for points that are within or not within the given polygon. Points on the boundary of the polygon are considered within. Note that this method is overloaded to allow searching of either points in a given polygon or polygons that contain a given point.
        Parameters:
        column - The column to compare. Must be a column of type spatialpoint.
        beanPathToSpatialColumn - Bean path to spatial column, including root entity.
        findIn - true for finding points in the polygon; false for finding points outside the polygons.
        polygon - the polygon to search
        Returns:
        this. Used for the builder pattern

      • compareIgnoreCase

        Restriction<QT> compareIgnoreCase(PropertyReference<Bean,String> propRef,
                                Relop op,
                                String value)
        Compares a property against a value given an operation type. The comparison is done using the configured lignuistic search function, which varies by database type, but is typically "lower", that is, case insenstively.
        Parameters:
        propRef -
        op - The operation
        value - The value
        Returns:
        this. Used for the builder pattern

      • compareIgnoreCase

        Restriction<QT> compareIgnoreCase(String propertyName,
                                Relop op,
                                Object value)
        Compares a property against a value given an operation type. The comparison is done using the configured lignuistic search function, which varies by database type, but is typically "lower", that is, case insenstively. Value must be of type String. If a case-insensitive comparison that helps drive the query plan is done on a large table, then the property should have the supportsLinguisticSearch attribute and the denorm column indexed.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - The property to compare
        op - The operation
        value - The value
        Returns:
        this. Used for the builder pattern
